ResponsesInList.Title: Custom Pages are an amazing Workplace feature
ResponsesInList.Text: Workplace has a Custom Pages feature that allows a page of Block content to exist outside of a "Course" context . Links to these Custom Pages automatically appear on the navigation menu when set to be visible. This is very powerful as you have the ability to define who can see these custom pages. For example, you can have a page that only Guests can see, another page that only Authenticated Users can see,Â and you can even make a " Dashboard " that only a specific "Roles" or specific "Users" can see (I made a reporting Dashboard for my one supervisor that only they can see). One tip I wanted to share is how to prevent a Custom page from automatically appearing on the custom menu. (For example, I created a "Learning Center" Custom Page thatÂ contains links to two other Custom Pages, but I don't want these two otherÂ  Custom Pages to appear on the main Navigation menu.) Use the id# located in the Custom Page's URL and insert that numberÂ  at the end of the code below: /* Hide a specific Custom Page from the Primary Navigation Menu */ .primary-navigation li[data-key="tool_custompage- 21 "] {display: none;}

ResponsesInList.Text: When deleting jobs using the user upload interface, I've noticed not all jobs are always deleted. ResponsesInList.Title: When removing jobs via user upload, if the job is already deleted, it gets added back
ResponsesInList.Text: I just tested on my WP environment (version 4.4) and here is what I see: Using the following fields, jobs were added for my 4 users: username jobdepartment1 jobposition1 jobstartdate1 jobenddate1 jobdelete1 sampleuser1 sampledept sampleposition 2024-09-23 2025-09-23 0 sampleuser2Â  sampledept sampleposition 2024-09-23 2025-09-23 0 sampleuser3Â  sampledept sampleposition 2024-09-23 2025-09-23 0 sampleuser4Â  sampledept sampleposition 2024-09-23 2025-09-23 0 it did delete a job when using the following fields in a separate CSV; username jobdepartment1 jobposition1 jobdelete1 sampleuser sampledept samplepos 1 I'm not sure the 0 means don't add it back, I think 0 means "ignore the column", and 1 means "do this column's action"... so when you're adding 0s to previous positions that were deleted, then by including them in the CSV in the future I think it makes sense that they are added back in, meaning, the "0" is not a "no action" for the row, but instead a "no action" for the column if that makes sense. So if you want to reuse a CSV, any 1s should remain 1s in future runs of the CSV (and even though it's already deleted, it will simply just look to delete again the next run and if there's nothing to delete then it's just ignored and not added back).

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Dynamic Rules - Notification
ResponsesInList.Text: The Dynamic Rules look at courses as a whole so it can automate actions based on various course completion statuses, so it won't include options at the individual activity completion level. Consider these options: Overdue activities : T he Pulse plugin ( https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_pulse ) -- it's capable to send reminders for after specific dates if an activity remains overdue. Since Relative Dates is considered an experimental feature at this time, I do not know if it knows to utilize the student's relative due date or not, but if you create a test course with relative dates enabled and pick an activity with an upcoming due date, then set up this plugin in the course to send an overdue message, you can then enroll a a test user after that due date has passed to see if they will get the message on their respective due date. The Reengagement plugin ( https://moodle.org/plugins/mod_reengagement ) also can send reminders for overdue content. Upcoming activities: Both the plugins mentioned above state they have capabilities to send notifications about upcoming activities. Then, there's the built-in Moodle's Analytics system's model for Upcoming activities due (if it's not there by default, you just click add a New model).Â This will send emails or Web alerts (depending on how the site admin sets up default Messaging - Notification Preferences for "Insights generated by prediction models") at one of three defined intervals: Upcoming week, upcoming 3 days, or upcoming fortnight. With that said, it wont provide a list of the activities,Â instead it directs users to the dashboard 's timeline where they can see/access the upcoming activities. To give it a try with a test user, it's rather simple to set up and get going - while you are testing this out you can turn off these notifications at the site level, then edit the preferences of your test users and enable it just for them so only get that email/web alert. Another option to see the data it will generate for the test usersÂ is to go the Analytics Models admin settings page, find the upcoming activities due model and select the test users from the dropdown in the Insights column (they will only appear here once the analytic model has finished running for the interval) to see if they have any upcoming items due data generated, or next to that dropdown select "Actions - Insight Report" and then the particular user to see a report of the data. These are the approaches that I have used in my institution so just wanted to share in case you see any value in these options.
